meanings.definition: Having knuckles or joints that are prominent or bony.
meanings.sent1: Her knuckly fingers gripped the handle tightly.
meanings.sent2: The old tree had a knuckly trunk covered in moss.
meanings.sent3: The knuckly branches of the tree looked like twisted fingers reaching out.
meanings.sent4: The knuckly rocks in the riverbed stood out like ancient bones.
meanings.sent5: The knuckly appearance of the old man's hands revealed years of hard work.

meanings.sent1: The knuckly texture of the wall made it difficult to paint.
meanings.sent2: The knuckly pattern on the fabric added a unique touch to the design.
meanings.sent3: The knuckly surface of the sculpture gave it a rough and rugged look.
meanings.sent4: The knuckly outline of the mountain range was visible against the sky.
meanings.sent5: The knuckly feel of the rock reminded her of sandpaper.

meanings.definition: Having knuckles that are large or prominent.
meanings.sent1: His knuckly hands were perfect for gripping the heavy tools.
meanings.sent2: The boxer's knuckly fists packed a powerful punch.
meanings.sent3: The knuckly appearance of the door handle made it easy to grasp.
meanings.sent4: The knuckly joints of the robot's fingers allowed for precise movements.
meanings.sent5: The knuckly shape of the mountain peak stood tall against the horizon.
